titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Fred H. Cowart II Papers, 1966-1998 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Fred H. Cowart II Papers, 1966-1998 and undated
did.abstract: Papers of Lubbock graphic artist Fred H. Cowart II from 1966-1998 and undated.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: A Lubbock graphic artist, historian, petroleum draftsman, and poet, Fred Cowart was also Chief illustrator for Reese Air Force Base. He composed The Firepower Theme, which was written in 1983 in honor of the U.S. Air Force Thunderbirds aerobatics team. The materials came from Mr. Cowart's personal collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, scrapbook material, literary production, and printed material. For the scrapbook material, the collection contains envelope art and personal writings. Printed material includes the Firepower theme and information on various military precision flight teams such as the Thunderbirds and the Blue Angels.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Organizations)
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Naval Flight Demonstration Squadron

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Fred Cowart Papers, 1966-1998 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas
